conclusion: Determine the magnitude and direction of the frictional force at t = 2.5 s.
Magnetic flux Œ¶ through the wire frame is given by Œ¶ = B ¬∑ A.
The side length of the wire frame is 0.2 m.
Half of the wire frame is in the magnetic field, so A = 0.02 m¬≤.
Magnetic induction intensity B as a function of time is B = (3 + 2t) T.
At t = 2.5 s, B = 8 T.
Magnetic flux Œ¶ at t = 2.5 s is 0.16 Wb.
Induced EMF is given by Faraday's law: ùìî = -dŒ¶/dt.
Rate of change of magnetic flux: dŒ¶/dt = A dB/dt.
Rate of change of B is dB/dt = 2 T/s.
Induced EMF ùìî = 0.04 V.
Induced current I is given by Ohm's law: I = ùìî/R.
Total resistance R = 4 Œ©.
Induced current I = 0.01 A.
Force on the wire frame is given by F = BIL.
Length of the side of the wire frame in the magnetic field is 0.2 m.
Force F = 0.016 N.
Frictional force f must balance the magnetic force F: f = 0.016 N.
Direction of frictional force is opposite to the magnetic force, acting to the left.
